content: Is there an example available that shows an Observation with .contained Provenance? This would be most interesting if it has multiple Provenance (create, update, update) within the Observation. ANY resource would be fine, picking on Observation as one that is most popular.
Aren't the references going the wrong way to do that (from Provenance to Observation and not vice-versa)?
You can have a contained resource that references the container.

You can have a contained resource that references the container.

that is what I expected... but would love to see an example
There is one somewhere - it blew up the validator once :)

Mhhh,..the spec seems to agree with my initial comment: 'A contained resource SHALL only be included in a resource if something in that resource (potentially another contained resource) has a reference to it.' - http://hl7.org/fhir/references.html#contained
dom-3 (http://hl7.org/fhir/domainresource.html#invs) was specifically updated in R4 to allow the contained to reference the container, so that SHALL is in error. Can you submit a change request?

I see a narrative example of Provenance in containment on the page on contained http://build.fhir.org/references.html#contained
But this is just a fragment, which is very useful, but not as useful as a complete example.
